title: Calculus I
description: Calculus I is the first course in the calculus sequence and introduces the fundamental concepts of calculus: Limits, Derivatives, Integrals. Topics include limits, continuity, derivatives, and integrals of algebraic and transcendental functions of one variable, applications of these concepts and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.

title: Calculus II
description: Calculus II is a continuation of Calculus I. This course covers advanced integration techniques, sequences and series, polar coordinates, and parametric equations. It also introduces the concepts of vectors in two and three dimensions.

title: Calculus III
description: Calculus III, also known as multivariable calculus, extends the concepts learned in calculus I and II to higher dimensions. Topics include vectors and vector-valued functions, partial derivatives, multiple integrals, and vector calculus in 2 and 3-space.

title: Linear Algebra
description: Linear algebra is the branch of mathematics concerning linear equations such as linear functions such as and their representations through matrices and vector spaces.
